Interview given, 23rd May 2023:

With Adriaan Kamp & Miss Metaverse
The Future Now Show
clubofamsterdam.com/the-future-now-show

Adriaan Kamp, Founder of Energy For One World, on the implications of the War in the Ukraine, the Geopolitics of Emotions and Halfway The UN 2030 Agenda - on Peace, Energy, Economies, Climate Change & Actions the realization of the UN SDGs.

Where are we in our Energy Realities, what lessons have we learned over a decade of Energy Transition, UNSDGs and Climate Action, and what are the present thoughts and opportunities for making a good future: Energy-Economies Free of Concerns.

What is going well? What deserves our attention? And where can we make the better interventions - coming monday morning - to make a great future.

profile_positions.location: From Oslo, Norway and Company based in The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Energy For One World (EFOW) is a boutique consulting firm, based on decades of industry experience at RoyalDutch/Shell International, but focused on organizing the delivery of Sustainable Energy-Economy Architectures and UN Sustainable Developments into Sustainable Societies. 

Given the realities we are today in (e.g. Ukraine War), our year 2023 theme and focus is: 

How are we doing Halfway 2030?

"In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities,
but in the expert's there are few."- Shunryu Suzuki (1905-1971)

In very simple terms- one could state that we –the energy sector- we have the following three and common goals:

- Support the UN Sustainable Development Goals.
- Implement the Paris Agreement.
- Help build Sustainable Societies

whereby Energy is further closely linked to the Geo-politics of Emotions, Security and not the least our Economies, Ecology and Societies.

How can we best support and/or improve the present international working approaches and policies towards Energy, Climate Change and the UN SDGs-, and whereby our goal is to realize :

Energy, Societies and Economies Free of Concerns. Here and There. Now and tomorrow?

The invitation is, and Halfway 2030, to see with open minds, to share in our awareness, find “the  tone of voice”, the organisational “forms and formats- the  bridges" and “perhaps see more simpler and direct ways to drive the human and corporate capacities and capabilities for deliveries”  and by which we can integrate corporate, national and civic interests, formulate the (energy-economy) programs- that makes some common sense.  

Perhaps, and at times, re-engineer the present “institutionalized modes ” in the sector and into our ministries: to support a true step-change and transit towards new energy architectures- locally, regionally and internationally.
